medical_history.chief_complaint: Two pediatric patients with adrenal masses suspected to be pheochromocytomas were found to have ganglioneuromas upon surgical examination.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The first patient, a 6-year-old girl, initially presented with multiple small nodules on her tongue, later found to be mucosal neuromas, and had thyroid enlargement leading to surgical intervention. The second patient, an 11-year-old boy, was evaluated for MEN2A after familial diagnosis and showed a hypodense adrenal mass on CT scan. Both patients ultimately underwent surgery due to suspected pheochromocytomas.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The first patient was diagnosed with MEN2B with a heterozygous RET proto-oncogene mutation; the second patient had a family history of MTC and RET mutation, confirming MEN2A.
medical_history.family_history: The second patient had a brother diagnosed with MTC and a mother with MTC and bilateral pheochromocytomas.
